item.title: The Jackal and the Drum
item.description: Once upon a time, in a dense forest teeming with life, there lived a sly and cunning jackal named Jithu. Jithu was known throughout the forest for his clever tricks and deceitful ways, always looking for opportunities to outsmart his fellow creatures. One day, as Jithu was prowling through the forest in search of his next meal, he stumbled upon a large drum lying abandoned by the side of the path
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Chicken and the Pearl
item.description: Once upon a time, in a quaint village nestled amidst rolling hills, there lived a proud and majestic chicken named Koushik. Koushik strutted about the village with his vibrant plumage on display, crowing loudly to announce the break of dawn each day. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Hare and the Moon
item.description: Once upon a time, in a tranquil meadow illuminated by the soft glow of the moon, there lived a lively hare named Shashak. Shashak was known throughout the meadow for her boundless energy and adventurous spirit, always seeking new thrills and excitement. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Clever Bat
item.description: Once upon a time, in a dense forest shrouded in darkness, there lived a clever bat named Nakshatra. Nakshatra was known throughout the forest for his sharp wit and cunning mind, traits that had helped him navigate the challenges of his nocturnal existence. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Butterfly and the Caterpillar
item.description: Once upon a time, in a vibrant meadow teeming with life, there lived a curious caterpillar named Karan. Karan spent his days crawling through the grass, munching on leaves, and dreaming of the adventures that lay beyond the confines of his leafy home. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fish and the Ring
item.description: Once upon a time, in a bustling coastal village, there lived a humble fisherman named Priya. Priya spent his days casting his nets into the sparkling sea, hoping for a bountiful catch to provide for his family. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Mouse and the Bull
item.description: Once upon a time, in a vast and sprawling meadow, there lived a tiny mouse named Milo and a powerful bull named Boris. Milo, though small in stature, possessed a heart as courageous as that of any creature in the meadow. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Two Frogs
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush and vibrant forest, there lived two frogs named Fredrick and Felix. Fredrick was adventurous and bold, always eager to explore new places and seek out excitement. Felix, on the other hand, was cautious and content to stay within the safety of their pond, preferring the comfort of familiarity. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Woodpecker and the Lion
item.description: Once upon a time, in the heart of a dense forest, there lived a wise and courageous woodpecker named Percival. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Oak Tree and the Reeds
item.description: Once upon a time, in a tranquil meadow surrounded by tall grasses and swaying reeds, there stood a mighty oak tree. The oak tree was strong and proud, its branches reaching high into the sky, casting a wide shade over the meadow. Nearby, a group of slender reeds grew along the edge of a babbling brook. Unlike the oak tree, the reeds were delicate and flexible, swaying gracefully with the gentle b
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Tiger, the Brahmin, and the Jackal
item.description: In a lush forest filled with tall trees and winding rivers, there lived a wise Brahmin. One day, as the Brahmin wandered through the forest, he stumbled upon a ferocious tiger trapped in a deep pit. The tiger pleaded with the Brahmin to help him escape, promising not to harm him in return. Moved by compassion, the Brahmin agreed to help the tiger. Using a sturdy vine, he lowered it into the pit,
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Happy Prince
item.description: Once upon a time, in a city adorned with statues and gardens, there stood a magnificent statue of a prince. The statue was covered in gold leaf, with eyes made of sapphires and a ruby embedded in its hilt. It was known as the Happy Prince. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Wolf and the Crane
item.description: Once upon a time, in the heart of a dense forest, there lived a fierce and cunning wolf named Winston. Winston was known throughout the forest for his strength and cunning, but he was also notorious for his greedy and selfish ways. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Eagle and the Fox

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Farmer and the Golden Eggs
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village nestled amidst rolling hills and lush green fields, there lived a humble farmer named Jack. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Grateful Prince

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Ant and the Grasshopper
item.description: Once upon a time, in a bustling meadow, there lived an industrious ant named Andy and a carefree grasshopper named Greg. Summer had arrived, and the meadow was abundant with vibrant flowers and lush greenery. Andy, the ant, was a diligent worker. He spent his days collecting food and storing it in his anthill. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Leopard
item.description: In a dense forest, there lived a clever fox named Felix and a graceful leopard named Leona. Despite being very different in appearance and habits, they were good friends and often shared stories near a serene pond. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Caged Bird and the Free Bird
item.description: In a lush and vibrant forest, there were two birds: one lived in a golden cage, and the other soared freely through the open skies. The caged bird had vibrant plumage, and its melodic songs filled the air. However, no matter how beautiful its cage, the bird longed for the freedom it saw in the free bird that soared above the trees. One day, the free bird landed on the golden bars of the cage, an
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Boy and the Apple Tree
item.description: In a quaint village nestled between rolling hills, there was a wise old apple tree that stood in the center of a small orchard. One day, a curious boy named Oliver discovered the ancient apple tree. Intrigued by the stories he had heard, he
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Elephant’s Child
item.description: Once upon a time, in the High and Far-Off Times, there was a curious elephant's child who had a very small nose. The other elephants in the jungle had long trunks, but the elephant's child was curious about everything and wanted to know what the crocodile had for dinner. So, one day, the elephant's child went to the Limpopo River, where the great grey-green, greasy Limpopo River runs
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Little Engine That Could
item.description: In a small town nestled between rolling hills, there was a little blue engine. It wasn't the biggest or the strongest, but it had a heart full of determination. One day, a big train carrying toys and goodies for children broke down on its way over the mountain. The toys and goodies were stranded, and the town was sad because the children were eagerly waiting for their treats. The big engines
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Hedgehog
item.description: In a peaceful forest, there lived a clever fox named Finley and a wise hedgehog named Hazel. Despite their differences, they were good friends and often shared stories near a large oak tree. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Princess and the Seven Swans
item.description: Once upon a time, in a faraway kingdom, there was a wise and kind king who had seven sons and a beautiful daughter named Eliza. The queen, unfortunately, had passed away, and the king remarried. However, the new queen was an evil sorceress who despised the king's children, especially Eliza. One day, the wicked queen cast a spell on Eliza's seven brothers, turning them into swans. The curs
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Fox and the Rabbit
item.description: In a peaceful meadow bordered by a dense forest, there lived a wise and cunning fox named Felix and a timid but clever rabbit named Rosie. The two animals were neighbors, sharing the meadow as their home. One day, Rosie discovered a bountiful patch of delicious carrots on the outskirts of the meadow. Knowing that winter was approaching and food would become scarce, she decided to collect and stor
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Patty, the milkmaid
item.description: In a small village, there lived a young milkmaid named Patty. Every day, Patty would milk the cows and carry the pail of fresh milk to the market to sell. As she walked, she often daydreamed about the future. One day, while on her way to the market, Patty began to imagine what she would do with the money she earned from selling the milk. "I'll buy a dozen eggs from the market," she
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Wicked Lion and the Hare
item.description: In a dense and vibrant forest, there lived a wicked lion named Karna. Karna was feared by all the animals because of his cruel and unjust ways. One day, he came across a wise and quick-witted hare named Hari. Karna, driven by his wicked nature, decided to make Hari's life miserable. He would often threaten the hare, boasting about his strength and power. However, Hari, being wise, always mana
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Elephants and the King of Mice
item.description: Once upon a time, in a dense and ancient forest, there lived a mighty elephant herd. The elephants, known for their strength and wisdom, were led by a wise and noble elephant named Arjun. Arjun was not only respected by his fellow elephants but also by the other animals in the forest. In the heart of the forest, there existed a community of mice ruled by their wise and just king, named Mahendra.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Crane and the Crab
item.description: In a serene pond surrounded by lush greenery, lived a crane named Kamal. Kamal was known for his long legs and sharp beak, but more so for his sly and cunning nature. On the banks of the pond, there resided a wise crab named Chandan. One day, Kamal approached Chandan with a proposition. "Dear Chandan," said Kamal with a devious smile, "I've heard there's a bountiful harvest
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Hunter and the Magical Bird
item.description: Once upon a time, in a dense and enchanted forest, there lived a hunter named Ravi. Ravi was known for his exceptional skill with a bow and arrow. One day, as he ventured deeper into the forest, he heard a melodious song, unlike any birdcall he had ever heard. Intrigued, Ravi followed the enchanting melody until he stumbled upon a dazzling bird with feathers that shimmered in every color imaginab
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The crow and the pitcher
item.description: Once upon a scorching summer day, a thirsty crow searched desperately for water. After a long flight, the crow finally spotted a pitcher in a garden. Eager with anticipation, the crow hurriedly flew down to the pitcher, hoping to find relief from its thirst. However, much to the crow's disappointment, the water level in the pitcher was too low for it to reach with its beak. The crow tried pec
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The weaver and the princess
item.description: In a kingdom far, far away, there was a wise and talented weaver named Arvind. His intricate designs and vibrant patterns were known throughout the land, and his skill was unmatched. The kingdom's princess, Princess Lila, had heard of Arvind's craftsmanship and desired to have the most exquisite tapestry ever woven. Arvind, upon receiving the royal request, eagerly set to work. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: A Daring Plan
item.description: Once upon a time in the peaceful town of Eldoria, there lived a young and courageous girl named Maya. Eldoria was known for its lush green fields and vibrant meadows, but it faced a looming threat from a neighboring kingdom. The ruthless King Zephyr had set his sights on Eldoria, craving its wealth and prosperity. Maya, with a heart full of bravery, could not stand idly by as her town faced the i
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Real Mother
item.description: Two women came before King Solomon, each claiming to be the mother of the same baby. Both women lived in the same house and had given birth within days of each other. One of the babies had died, and now both women were fiercely arguing over who was the real mother of the living child. Unable to resolve the dispute, King Solomon, known for his wisdom, devised a plan to reveal the true mother. He o
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Stolen Crown
item.description: One day, the king's crown went missing, and there was an uproar in the kingdom. The guards were questioned, and an investigation was launched. Suspicion fell on a few courtiers, and they were interrogated, but no one confessed. In the midst of this chaos, Tenali Raman approached the king and said, "Your Majesty, I can find the thief and retrieve your crown, but I need a week to do so.&qu
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Golden Egg
item.description: Once upon a time, in a peaceful village, there lived a poor farmer named John. Despite his modest lifestyle, John was content with his simple life. He owned a small piece of land, a humble house, and a few hens. One day, while tending to his chores, John made a remarkable discovery. One of his hens had laid an egg that shone with a brilliant golden hue. Astonished and excited, John realized that
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Cat's Judgement
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush and lively forest, there lived a proud and haughty cat named Jasper. Jasper was known far and wide for his sleek fur and graceful demeanor. One day, as Jasper was basking in the sunlight, he overheard a group of birds chatting about a grand feast that was to be held in the honor
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Union is Strength
item.description: Once upon a time, there was an old man who had three sons. Despite their constant bickering and disagreements, the old man remained hopeful that his sons would learn the value of unity. To teach them this important lesson, the old man handed each son a single stick and asked them to break it. Unsurprisingly, each son easily snapped his stick in half. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Loyal Mongoose
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a childless couple who longed for a family. One day, their wish was granted when they found a baby mongoose abandoned near their home. Filled with joy, they adopted the little creature and named him Raj. As Raj grew, he became a beloved member of the family, providing companionship and filling their home with happiness. The couple, in turn, shower
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Stork and the Crab
item.description: In a serene lakeside, there lived a stork named Stanley and a clever crab named Clara. They had been neighbors for quite some time, observing each other's unique ways of life. One day, as Stanley was gracefully standing in the shallow waters, he noticed Clara scurrying along the muddy shore. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Brahmin’s dream
item.description: In a small village, there lived a kind-hearted Brahmin named Ravi. He was known for his honesty, generosity, and deep devotion to his spiritual practices. One night, after a long day of serving the community and studying ancient scriptures, Ravi fell into a deep sleep. In his dream, Ravi found himself in a distant land where he discovered a magnificent treasure buried beneath a tree. The treasure
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The foolish thief
item.description: Once upon a time, in a small village, there lived a notorious thief named Jake. Jake was known for his cunning ways, as he would often devise elaborate plans to steal from the townspeople. However, despite his cleverness, Jake had a reputation for being rather foolish. One day, Jake decided to target the village's wealthiest resident, Mr. Roberts. He had heard rumors of a precious diamond hid
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: The Monkey and the Crocodile
item.description: Once upon a time, in a lush jungle beside a glistening river, there lived a clever monkey named Max and a friendly crocodile named Cody. Max and Cody had developed an unlikely friendship, spending their days chatting and sharing stories on a large rock by the riverbank. One day, as they sat together, Cody revealed a secret to Max. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: Be wise while counting
item.description: Once upon a time, in a bustling marketplace, there was a fruit vendor named Jack. Jack was known for his honesty and fair dealings. He took great pride in carefully counting and weighing each fruit to ensure accurate pricing for his customers. One day, a young boy named Timmy approached Jack's fruit stand. He wanted to buy some apples for his family. Jack greeted Timmy with a warm smile and b
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K

item.title: A Wise Old Owl
item.description: In the heart of a dense forest, perched high on a sturdy branch, lived a wise old owl named Oliver. With his sparkling eyes and a coat of feathers that glowed in the moonlight, Oliver was respected by all the animals of the forest for his wisdom and counsel. item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K
